item.title: Asaduzzaman resigns as attorney general to contest in parliamentary elections
item.description: Md Asaduzzaman has tendered his resignation as attorney general to the president, formally stepping down from the country’s top legal post. Deputy Attorney General Md Jahirlul Islam Sumon told bdnews24.com that Asaduzzaman handed in his resignation letter at the Attorney General’s Offi

item.title: Zubayer Rahman Chowdhury takes oath as Chief Justice
item.description: Justice Zubayer Rahman Chowdhury on Sunday took oath as the 26th Chief Justice of Bangladesh. President Mohammed Shahabuddin administered the oath at Bangabhaban at 10:30am on Sunday. Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus, among others, attended the oath-takig ceremony which was broadcast live by Ban

item.title: NBR extends income tax return deadline to January 31
item.description: The government has extended the deadline for submitting income tax returns for individual taxpayers for the second time for the 2025–26 tax year. According to an order issued by the National Board of Revenue (NBR), the return submission deadline has been extended from December 31, 2025 to Ja

item.title: More countries reject Israel's recognition of Somaliland
item.description: A growing number of countries on Saturday rejected Israel's recognition of Somalia’s breakaway region of Somaliland as an independent nation a day earlier, the first by any country in more than 30 years. It wasn't known why Israel made the declaration Friday or whether the country was expect

item.title: BNP collects Tarique Rahman’s nomination papers for Dhaka-17 seat
item.description: Nomination papers for BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman have been collected for the Dhaka-17 constituency ahead of the 13th national election. The papers were picked up on Sunday morning from the office of the Dhaka Divisional Commissioner in Segunbagicha by BNP chairperson's aide ABM Abdus Satta

item.title: Jamaat not a ‘reliable ally’, NCP may pay ‘heavy price’, says Samantha
item.description: Samantha Sharmin, senior joint convenor of the National Citizen Party (NCP), has said Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami is “not a reliable ally” and warned that the party may have to “pay a heavy price” if it seeks cooperation or reaches any agreement with the Islamist group. She

item.title: Charge sheet in Haadi murder case likely within 10 days
item.description: Police expect to submit a charge sheet within the next seven to ten days in the murder case of Sharif Osman Hadi, spokesperson of Inqilab Moncho. “We will be able to submit the charge sheet within the next seven to ten days, Insha’Allah,” said Additional Commissioner of Dhaka Met

item.title: Hadi murder: Two associates of Faisal arrested in India
item.description: Police say they have now confirmed that Faisal Karim, the prime suspect in the killing of Inqilab Moncho leader Sharif Osman Hadi, is no longer in the country. At a media briefing on Sunday, Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) Additional Commissioner SN Md Nazrul Islam said investigators had establish

item.title: Government cancels certificates of 71 fake freedom fighters
item.description: The government has cancelled the freedom fighter certificates of 71 individuals after determining that they were not involved in Bangladesh’s Liberation War, officials said. A gazette notification annulling the certificates was issued on December 24, following an earlier official order by th

item.title: NCP leader Tajnuva Jabeen resigns amid reports of Jamaat alliance
item.description: Tajnuva Jabeen, a senior leader of the National Citizen Party (NCP), has resigned from the youth-led political group amid reports of a potential alliance between the party and Jamaat-e-Islami. She announced her decision in a Facebook post at 12:35pm on Sunday, reports bdnews24.com. Tajnuva had be

item.title: Tarique visits BNP chairperson’s office
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman visited the party chairperson's office in the capital's Gulshan area on Sunday, marking his first visit to the office since his return to the country. BNP Standing Committee Member Khandaker Mosharraf Hossain received Tarique Rahman at 1:42 pm, said BNP media cel

item.title: Sylhet Gas Fields Limited's AGM held
item.description: The 43rd Annual General Meeting of Sylhet Gas Fields Limited (SGFL), one of the gas and petroleum products producing companies of Petrobangla, was held on 18 December 2025 at 7:00pm at the conference room of the company’s Dhaka Liaison Office at Petrocenter, Dhaka.
